article_title: Karl Marx is the most assigned economist in U.S. college classes
article_text:
A MarketWatch blog post on Jan. 27 incorrectly stated search results from the Open Syllabus Project database of U.S. college syllabi. The databse’s algorithms have difficulty discerning titles of books with no specific author, so works such as the Bible and the U.S. Constitution aren’t included in the database. See corrected post.

More from MarketWatch
